intro: Rauvolfia rhonhofiae, commonly known as the Rhonhofia evergreen, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
